document_data.name: ''Pipes of Sounding''
document_data.mainbody: '''''Pipes of sounding''''' were [[enchanted]] [[birdpipes]] that allowed the player to create a vide variety of sounds.
document_data.Powers: When a skilled performer played ''pipes of sounding'', they could generate various ''[[illusory]]'' sounds, similar in function to the ''[[ghost sound]]'' spell.
document_data.Creation: ''Pipes of sounding'' could be constructed by a capable crafter of wondrous items with the use of the ''ghost sound'' spell.
document_data.History: Sometime before the fall of [[Myth Drannor]] in the [[Weeping War]] of [[714 DR]], a masterwork set of magical ''pipes of sounding'' was the life-long creation project of the City of Song's Loresinger. However, the Loresinger perised before his project was completed and interred in the [[Polyandrium]] within the [[Loresinger's Crypt]]. The crafting recipe and research for ''pipes of sounding'' could be found within the crypt when it was unsealed in [[1369 DR]].
document_data.Notable Owners:
*[[Andorra of the Many Veils]]: a dancer from the city of [[Huzuz]] ''circa'' [[1367 DR]].
*[[Arkiem Arren]]: a talented performer, musician, and a [[celric]] of [[Milil]] from the City of Splendors ''circa'' [[1368 DR]].
*[[Obslin Minstrelwish]]: the Seneschal of [[Twilight Hall]] in [[Berdusk]] and one of the [[High Harpers]] ''circa'' [[1370 DR]].
*[[Olothontor]]: a [[blue dragon]] also known as “the Minstrel Wyrm” possessed a set of ''pipes of sounding'' tucked away in his hoard ''circa'' [[1374 DR]].
*[[Taraunramorlamurla]]: a [[song dragon]], active ''circa'' 1374 DR.
